intro: Phyllactis bracteata, commonly known as the bracted phyllactis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or along stream banks. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical applications are not well-documented.
